title: Refund reversal
name: RefundReversal
description: A Refund Reversal, also called Refund VOID allows the merchant to reverse a previous refund operation. This operation reverts (if possible) a specific refund identified with a transaction id. In it's simplest form you only have to pass the amount, currency and originalTransactionID but it also accepts a map with extra parameters. Note that transactions can only be reversed within the same day as the transaction was made.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.notes: Amount of funds to charge - in the minor unit of currency (f.ex. 1000 is 10.00 GBP)

parameters.name: originalTransactionID
parameters.notes: As received from the card reader (EFTTransactionID)

parameters.name: map
parameters.notes: A map including extra optional transaction parameters.

parameters.name: device
parameters.notes: This parameter specifies to the system which device you want to use for the operations. If none is supplied the system will attempt to use a default device, if any.

elements.name: currentTransactionStatus
elements.description: Invoked during a transaction, it fetches statuses coming from the card reader (ex : 'waiting for card' or 'waiting for PIN entry')

elements.name: signatureRequired
elements.description: Invoked if card verification requires signature.

elements.name: endOfTransaction
elements.description: Invoked when the card reader finishes processing the transaction

elements.name: Boolean
elements.description: true if the operation was successfully sent to device

example.code:
//Initiate a refund reversal for 10.00 in Great British Pounds
api.RefundReversal(new BigInteger(1000),Currency.GBP,"00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000");

title: Refund reversal
name: RefundReversal
description: A RefundReversal initiates a reversal operation for a previous refund operation to the card reader. This operation reverts (if possible) a specific refund identified with a transaction id. In it's simplest form you only have to pass the amount, currency and originalTransactionID but it also accepts a map with extra parameters. Note that transactions can only be reversed within the same day as the transaction was made.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.notes: Amount of funds to charge - in the minor unit of currency (f.ex. 1000 is 10.00 GBP)

parameters.name: originalTransactionID
parameters.notes: As received from the card reader (EFTTransactionID)

parameters.name: map
parameters.notes: A map including extra optional transaction parameters.

elements.name: currentTransactionStatus
elements.description: Invoked while during transaction with different statuses from card reader

elements.name: signatureRequired
elements.description: Invoked if card verification requires signature.

elements.name: endOfTransaction
elements.description: Invoked when the card reader finishes processing the transaction

elements.name: Boolean
elements.description: true if the operation was successfully sent to device

example.code:
//Initiate a refund reversal for 10.00 in Great British Pounds
api.RefundReversal(new BigInteger(1000),Currency.GBP,"1234567");
